comment.text: This translation key is used to display a success toast notification when a room template is saved as a template in the UI. The notification includes the title of the saved template and is displayed after saving. It appears in the application's global events section.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets <1> and </1> are present in both the English and Arabic translations, which is consistent, but should be verified for relevance to the application’s UI. It's possible these tags are only for display in a specific editor and should be removed from the final user-facing text.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Verify the purpose of the angle brackets and consider removing them if they are only for editor display.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets <1> and </1> are present in both the English and Azerbaijani content. While technically correct, they appear to be for internal markup and may not be intended for display to the user. Consider removing them if they are unnecessary in the user interface.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the <1> and </1> tags from the Azerbaijani translation if they are not necessary for display.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The German translation maintains the XML tags `<1>` and `</1>` just like the English content, which may not be desirable depending on the context and rendering requirements. While technically correct, it's worth checking if this is the intended behavior.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing or adjusting the XML tags if they are not essential for display.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Greek translation retains the HTML tags `<1>` and `</1>` just like the English content. While technically correct, this might not be necessary or desirable in the Greek user interface. It's worth considering removing them or adjusting the rendering.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing or adjusting the rendering of the HTML tags `<1>` and `</1>` to improve the UI's aesthetics and readability.  The content 'Room template' could potentially be integrated directly into the sentence.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English "Room" is translated as "Sala" (room) which is technically correct but might be better translated to something more specific to templates, like "Modelo" (model) or "Diseño" (design). The best option depends on the specific context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider translating 'Room' as 'Modelo' or 'Diseño' for better clarity within the template context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Finnish translation retains the HTML tags '<1>' and '</1>' identical to the English source. While technically correct, it's unusual and potentially unnecessary in a toast notification in Finnish. Consider removing or adapting them for a more natural user experience.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing the tags or adapting them to be more suitable for a Finnish toast notification. For example, if the HTML tags are simply intended to enclose a dynamic variable, it might be better to integrate the variable directly into the text without using tags.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'կաղապարը' (template) should be preceded by a definite article to match the English sentence structure. The English uses 'Room template' which implies a specific room template. The Armenian translation needs a definite article for 'կաղապար'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Սենյակի <1>«{{title}}»</1> կաղապարը պահպանվել է

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The verb 'պահպանված է' (saved) is in passive voice. While technically correct, 'պահպանվել է' is a more natural and common way to express 'saved' in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Սենյակի <1>«{{title}}»</1> կաղապարը պահպանվել է

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags `<1>` and `</1>` are inconsistent with the English content. The English uses `<1>` and `</1>`, while the Italian uses `<1>` and `</1>`. This could lead to rendering issues.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure the HTML tags match the original English content: `<1>` and `</1>`.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Japanese translation maintains the XML tags (<1>«{{title}}»</1>) which should ideally be removed or handled more gracefully depending on the intended display.  While technically correct, it's likely unnecessary and visually jarring.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider removing the XML tags or replacing them with a more appropriate display format, depending on how the toast is rendered.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Korean translation retains the HTML tags `<1>` and `</1>` from the English content. This is unnecessary and disrupts the natural flow of the Korean sentence.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the HTML tags `<1>` and `</1>` from the Korean translation. The sentence should read: «{{title}}» 룸 템플릿이 저장되었습니다

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While '룸 템플릿' is a reasonable translation for 'Room template', it is slightly less natural than alternatives.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using '방 템플릿' instead of '룸 템플릿'. '방' is a more common and natural word for 'room' in this context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation 'ບັນທຶກແມ່ແບບຫ້ອງ <1>«{{title}}»</1> ແລ້ວ' translates to 'Room template <1>«{{title}}»</1> saved' which is too literal.  A more natural Lao phrasing would emphasize the completion of the saving action.  'ແລ້ວ' at the end can sometimes feel abrupt and less conversational in this context.  While not strictly incorrect, it's not ideal.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ບັນທຶກແມ່ແບບຫ້ອງ <1>«{{title}}»</1> ໄວ້ແລ້ວ (Ban-thuk mae-baen hong <1>«{{title}}»</1> wai laeo) - This translates to 'Room template <1>«{{title}}»</1> saved (successfully)' and sounds more natural.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The tags <1> and </1> are present in both the English and Latvian versions. This suggests they might be placeholders for dynamic content that should be preserved. However, their necessity in the final UI should be verified.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Verify if the tags <1> and </1> are required for the UI rendering and if so, ensure they are handled correctly in the Latvian version.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>` and `</1>` tags are present in both the English and Dutch versions. While technically correct in terms of mirroring the structure, they might not be necessary or stylistically preferred in the Dutch UI. Consider if they are essential for functionality or visual representation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Evaluate if the `<1>` and `</1>` tags are required. If not, remove them for cleaner UI.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English word "saved" is best translated as "salvo" or "salva" depending on the gender of the template, rather than "guardados". 'Guardados' implies something being stored, not saved.  'Salvo' for masculine template names or 'salva' for feminine would be more accurate.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Templates de sala <1>«{{title}}»</1> salvo(a)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation preserves the HTML tags from the English source exactly, which may not be ideal for localization. Consider whether these tags are necessary in the Portuguese context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove unnecessary HTML tags. E.g., "Templates de sala «{{title}}» salvos"

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "Room template" is better translated as "Template de sala" rather than "Modelo de sala". While 'modelo' is a valid translation of 'template', 'template de sala' is a more natural and common phrasing in Portuguese (Brazil).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Template de sala <1>«{{title}}»</1> salvo

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets `<1>` are present in both the English and Romanian, which is appropriate for maintaining the structure. However, it's important to ensure this structure is properly handled in the UI.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Verify the UI displays the angle bracket structure as intended, or remove if not necessary.  If it's intended to indicate placeholder, ensure that's clear.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'sală' (room) is correctly spelled. No spelling errors found.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: N/A

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The grammar is correct. The phrase "a fost salvat" correctly translates to 'was saved'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: N/A

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'sală' is a good general translation for 'room', it's possible that a more specific term might be more suitable depending on the context of the template. Consider if 'room' refers to a specific type of room.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider context and potential alternatives like 'camera', 'spațiu', or 'locație' if a more specific translation is needed.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Sinhala translation 'සුරක්ෂිත කෙරිණි' translates to 'was saved'. The English says 'saved', implying a present tense action. While the difference is subtle, using the present tense 'සුරක්ෂිත වේ' would be more aligned with the English.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Room template <1>«{{title}}»</1> සුරක්ෂිත වේ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Slovak translation retains the XML-like tags (<1>«{{title}}»</1>) from the English source. These tags likely represent placeholders and should not be part of the displayed text in the Slovak version.  They are unnecessary and confusing to the user.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the tags <1>«{{title}}»</1> from the Slovak translation. The translated text should only be 'Šablóna miestnosti {{title}} uložená'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word "собе" is not the correct translation for "Room". It appears to be a shortened or incorrect form. "Соба" is also not correct. The appropriate translation would likely be "просторија" or potentially "амбијент" depending on the context, but "просторија" is more generally applicable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Шаблон просторије <1>«{{title}}»</1> сачуван

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags `<1>` and `</1>` are present in both the original and translation, which is fine. However, consider if this is truly necessary for the user interface. It might be better to remove them if they serve no purpose other than being placeholders for some internal system.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Шаблон просторије «{{title}}» сачуван (remove HTML tags if unnecessary)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets `<1>` and `</1>` are present in the Serbian translation and should match the English, indicating the placeholder for a dynamic value.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: No change needed, maintains original format.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'sačuvan' is a valid translation for 'saved', a more natural-sounding translation for this context would be 'spremljen'. 'Sačuvan' often implies preservation for a longer period.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Šablon sobe <1>«{{title}}»</1> spremljen
